item.title: Report E-2024100720
item.description:
Report E-2024100720

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN1830 Semi-Grade Sulfuric Acid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of UN1830 Semi-Grade Sulfuric Acid released to a 53’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and 800’ x 55’ area of the asphalt lot due to forklift puncture. The contractors used water and sodium bicarb mixture to clean the impacted areas. The damaged drum and impacted pallets were cut up and containerized. The impacted absorbents were collected and containerized. All waste was placed into (16) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100624
item.description:
Report E-2024100624

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 had a loose cap in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3082-impacted tote and trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100636
item.description:
Report E-2024100636

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 9:41 PM ET, XHG contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Quick Drying Asphaltum M-202, which released from (2) 5-gallon metal buckets due to being crushed by other freight prior to arrival. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal. The terminal cleaned the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into a 30 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.
